messages.messageBody:
Tia Leschke wrote:
>
> At 02:18 PM 08/02/2002 -0600, you wrote:
> >unschooling-dotcom-unsuscribe@...

>

> Tia
>

I think she figured it out since when I went to unsubscribe her
since was already gone!

Thanks for the help though!

--

Cindy Ferguson
crma@...

messages.messageBody:
unschooling-dotcom-unsuscribe@...

It's Groups, not Droops...

>i sent an email to unschooling-dotcom-unsuscribe@... but
>Yahoogroups responded saying there is no such address. please help because i
>want to unsuscribe from the mailing list
>
>thank you
>
>armi


*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*
Freedom. It's a Lifestyle and a Choice.
http://www.iboplus.com/NoRegrets
*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*

*************************************************************************
Paula Long
Mommy to Alexandria (11/20/95), 4 miscarried babies, and
Kadin, my precious baby boy (born still 07/29/98)

Honored Babies ~ http://www.HonoredBabies.org

Stillbirth . Neonatal Death . Infant Death

messages.subject: Re: unsucribe-help
messages.msgSnippet: dear friend, i sent an email to unschooling-dotcom-unsuscribe@yahoodroups.com but Yahoogroups responded saying there is no such address.  please help because i
messages.messageBody:
dear friend,

i sent an email to unschooling-dotcom-unsuscribe@... but
Yahoogroups responded saying there is no such address. please help because i
want to unsuscribe from the mailing list

thank you

armi
<tt>
I immediately sent this on.ï¿½ Anything that threatens to make our Chevies run<BR>
like a Ford is really BAD! <g><BR>
<BR>
----- Original Message -----<BR>
From: "Fetteroll" <fetteroll@...><BR>
To: "Fetterolls" <FetterollFamily@yahoogroups.com><BR>
Sent: Monday, February 04, 2002 6:02 AM<BR>
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Badtimes<BR>
<BR>
<BR>
><BR>
> Warning! The Mother of All Computer Viruses!<BR>
><BR>
> If you receive an e-mail entitled "Badtimes", delete it immediately. Do<BR>
not<BR>
> open it. Apparently, this one is pretty nasty. It will not only erase<BR>
> everything on your hard drive, but it will also delete anything on disks<BR>
> within 20 feet of your computer. It demagnetizes the strips on all your<BR>
> credit cards. It reprograms your ATM access code, screws up the tracking<BR>
on<BR>
> your VCR and uses subspace field harmonics to scratch any CD's you attempt<BR>
> to<BR>
> play.<BR>
><BR>
> If you drive a chevy, it will start missing like a Ford. It will program<BR>
> your<BR>
> phone auto dial to call only your mother-in-law's number. This virus will<BR>
> mix<BR>
> antifreeze into your fish tank. It will drink all your beer. It will leave<BR>
> dirty socks on the coffee table when you are expecting company.<BR>
><BR>
> It will replace your shampoo with Nair and your Nair with Rogaine, all the<BR>
> while dating your spouse behind your back and billing your Visa. It will<BR>
> cause you to run with scissors then fall and poke your eye out.<BR>
><BR>
> If the "Badtimes" message is opened in a Windows 95/98 environment, it<BR>
will<BR>
> leave the toilet seat up and leave your hair dryer plugged in dangerously<BR>
> close to a full bathtub. It will not only remove the forbidden tags from<BR>
> your<BR>
> mattresses and pillows, it will also refill your skim milk with whole<BR>
milk.<BR>
><BR>
> PLEASE FOR THE LOVE OF PETE, WARN AS MANY PEOPLE AS YOU CAN!<BR>
><BR>
> If you don't send this to 5,000 people in 20 seconds you'll fart so hard<BR>
> that<BR>
> your right leg will spasm and shoot straight out in front of you, sending<BR>
> sparks that will ignite the person nearest you.<BR>
><BR>
